project.teaser: The continuous effort and increased demand of the raw materials are directing the mining companies to excavate minerals at greater depths. This trend is challenging the current mining operations and the existing traditional technologies towards the objective to retain...
project.objective:
The continuous effort and increased demand of the raw materials are directing the mining companies to excavate minerals at greater depths. This trend is challenging the current mining operations and the existing traditional technologies towards the objective to retain profitability, while achieving the latest Green Deal environmental vision and securing human workers safety. A key enabler, to address these challenges and to foster a sustainable development of the mining industry, is the development and deployment of innovative technologies for resource efficient extraction of the EU’s raw materials, as well as near mine exploration of critical raw materials in currently non-extracted ore bodies in existing or abandoned ones.
PERSEPHONE is aiming to address these challenges by developing of the pioneering technologies for pushing the limits of EU mining industry and embodiment of autonomous and integrated near mine exploration capability to access deep deposits of critical raw materials through hard-to-reach deep and abandoned mines. The overall concept and vision of PERSEPHONE will be achieved by reducing the size of mining machines currently adapted to the human scale and embedding autonomy for risk-aware navigation and full digitalization of the extraction process by digital twin creation and key enabling technologies validation at TRL 5. Additionally, PERSEPHONE is introducing completely novel approaches in online near mine exploration core analysis and overall integration of related data analytics to the mine expansion. Thus, PERSEPHONE allows to foster green transition by reducing the cost and waste generated from deep-mining operations and foster the vision of zero human presence in highly hazardous areas. These will allow to achieve PERSEPHONE’s overall goal to digitalize and automate extraction value chain by creation of new concepts of energy-efficient autonomous drilling machines with advanced perception capabilities for navigation, face drilling, and core extraction, which will enable data-driven digital twin creation and geological modelling for further enhanced decision support and optimal extraction planning.
project.title: Autonomous Exploration and Extraction of Deep Mineral Deposits
project.keywords: Exploration Drilling, Excavation Drilling, Robotics, Geomodels

article.title: Getting to deep mineral deposits safer and more sustainably

result.title: Iterative evaluation of proposed technologies
result.description: Details about the integration and iterative evaluation of technologies developed in WP2 – WP5 onto the mining machine simulator.

result.title: Algorithms for sensor-based risk-assessment and traversability analysis
result.description: Novel algorithms for risk assessment and traversability analysis and validation on multi-sensor data from deep and abandoned mines.

result.title: Dissemination and communication plan
result.description: Plan for dissemination activities that will be carried out in the project. This includes a schedule on dissemination activities and communication channels which will be further updated during the project.The deliverable is the result of task 10.1

result.title: Novel path planning and multi-machine coordination algorithms
result.description: Design and validation in simulated environments of novel path-planning and multi-machine coordination algorithms, highlighting improvements over the state-of-the-art.

result.title: SPADE: Towards Scalable Path Planning Architecture on Actionable Multi-Domain 3D Scene Graphs

details.authors: Vignesh Kottayam Viswanathan, Akash Patel, Mario Alberto Valdes Saucedo, Sumeet Satpute, Christoforos Kanellakis, George Nikolakopoulos
details.journalTitle: International Conference on Intelligent Robots and Systems

result.title: Interim report on consortium-wide efforts at academic, industrial and public dissemination
result.description: Details about the consortium’s actions towards dissemination of the project results and outcomes such as scientific articles in journals, abstracts and proceedings in conferences.

result.title: Sensing methods for detecting drill sites and visual servoing for exploration drilling.
result.description: Sensing methodologies and accurate positioning algorithms for drilling machines and validation in simulated deep and abandoned mine-like environments.

result.title: Review, testing and evaluation of sensing techniques for online rock characterization in simulated environments
result.description: Results of the testing and validation of novel sensing technologies for real-time rock characterization and methods for integrating such sensors on drill rigs.

result.title: The PERSEPHONE project: Autonomous Exploration and Extraction of Deep Mineral Deposits

details.authors: Akash Patel, Anton Koval, Sumeet Gajanan Satpute, George Nikolakopoulos, Christian Burlet, Giorgia Stasi

result.title: Multi-machine mapping and map merging algorithms validated in simulated environments
result.description: Collaborative multi-machine algorithms to enable multi-machine operation in simulated deep/abandoned mines.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - PERSEPHONE (Autonomous Exploration and Extraction of Deep Mineral Deposits)

result.title: Initial report on open data releases, data management, innovation management and IP protection
result.description: Initial summary of the actions towards ensuring research verifiability/reproducibility of the PERSEPHONE results, such as open releases of data from lab experiments/ small scale field tests. Details about the establishment of Intellectual Property Office (IPO) and Innovation Management Office (IMO) and innovation support tools for protection of the partners’ IPs.

result.title: Realistic simulation worlds for integrated testing of PERSEPHONE technologies
result.description: Details about realistic simulation environments of deep and abandoned mines, which are used to evaluate and perfect the technologies of WP2-WP7, before deployment in the field.

result.title: An Actionable Hierarchical Scene Representation Enhancing Autonomous Inspection Missions in Unknown Environments

details.authors: Vignesh Kottayam Viswanathan, Mario Alberto Valdes Saucedo, Sumeet Gajanan Satpute, Christoforos Kanellakis, George Nikolakopoulos
details.journalTitle: International Conference on Intelligent Robots and Systems

result.title: A Hierarchical Graph-Based Terrain-Aware Autonomous Navigation Approach for Complementary Multimodal Ground-Aerial Exploration

result.title: Requirements, specifications and benchmarking tools for proposed technologies
result.description: Requirements, specifications and benchmarking tools for the evaluation of PERSEPHONE technologies (WP2-WP7) in line with UNFC/UNRMS.

result.title: Literature survey on SoA technologies and existing roadmaps in the mining industry
result.description: A comprehensive review of the SoA technologies relevant to PERSEPHONE, to enable the defining of requirements and specifications for the technical WPs.

result.title: Algorithms for autonomous drill planning and execution
result.description: Design and validation of the developed algorithms for drill planning and execution in simulated environments.

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: The DMP will be made available and evolve during the lifetime of the project in order to present the status of the project's reflections on data management.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
